Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-WY2 (Natural AMPs, Leu-rich, frog, amphibians, animals, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: cutaneous secretion, the Ranidae frog,Amolops wuyiensis, China, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (78.57%) toTemporin-1CdLeu: 38%; F=A: 15%. GRAVY: 2.03; mol Wt: 1445.852; mol formula: C74H120N14O15; mol ex coeff: 0.Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidatedActivity: active against Gram+ bacteria S. aureus ATCC CRM 6538 or MRSA BAA 1707 or clinical MRSA B038 V1S1 A (MIC 2 uM), E. faecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 4 uM), Gram- E. coli NCTC 8739 or clinical BAA 2340 (MIC 32 uM), P.aeruginosa ATCC 9027 or PA14 or PAO1 (MIC >128 uM), K.pneumoniae ATCC 43816 (MIC> 128 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (4. 5 mM), NH4Cl-insensitive:S. aureus (6 uM), CaCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (1 mM),  ZnCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (8 mM), FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (4 uM).   Salt-insensitive:MRSA.  Human serum-sensitive:MRSA (%?).Biofilms: S. aureus: Inhibited formation (MBIC 4 uM) but disruption strain-dependent (MBEC 32 to >128 uM). disrupted biofilms: E. faecalis (MBEC 32 uM).Structure:  helical in buffer (NH4AC) and helical in 50% TFE.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: HC50=32-64 uM.
Literature Information.Author: Liao F, Ye Z, Cheng J, Zhu J, Chen X, Zhou X, Wang T, Jiang Y, Ma C, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Discovery and engineering of a novel peptide, Temporin-WY2, with enhanced in vitro and in vivo efficacy against multi-drug resistant bacteria
